isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 1000 MODELS - ELECTRONIC COMPONENTS - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcprocinfo.para: Before beginning these test procedures, do the following:

item.para: Make sure the vehicle batteries are at 75% state of charge (SOC) or higher. This represents an open circuit voltage (OCV) of 12.4 volts. Batteries with an OCV of 12 volts or less are either completely discharged or have a dead cell.
Check any light or indicator lamp filaments that are suspected of being open (burned out). This is done to avoid unnecessary extensive circuit checks.
Inspect all connectors for loose or damaged pins, wires, etc. Refer to TEST EQUIPMENT AND CONNECTOR REPAIR section in GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the Master Service Manual.

When the technician determines that a fuse is blown, while checking its condition, he is directed to locate the cause of the overload condition and to repair it. While no further instruction on this procedure is listed in the diagnostic tables, the common procedure is as follows: isolate sections of the circuit by disconnecting connectors, and measure the resistance to ground to find the circuit that is shorted to ground. Then locate the damaged spot in the wire or connector and repair.

Diagnostics for circuits that are malfunctioning by sticking in the on position are generally not covered in detail. It is assumed that the technician knows to check for a malfunctioning switch, relay, or solenoid.

svcsubproc.title: ATA Data Link and Diagnostic/ Programming Connector

table.title: ATA Data Link and Diagnostic/ Programming Connector

entry.para: At ATA connector (384), measure voltage from cavity B circuit 97C to ground.
Check fuse F6 for open condition. If okay, locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97C, then repair.
Disconnect ECM2 connector (6021) and install jumper wires from cavity 20 circuit 98A(+) and cavity 21 circuit 98C(-) to ground.
At (384) measure resistance of circuits 98B(+)/98A(+) and 98A(+) to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuits 98B(+)/ 98A(+) and 98A(+) or dash conn. (3), then repair.
At (384) measure resistance of circuits 98D(-)/98C(-) and 98C(-) to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuits 98D(-)/98C(-) and 98C(-) or dash conn. (3), then repair.
Remove jumpers and reconnect (6021). Disconnect IDM2 connector (6011) and install jumper wires from cavity 2 circuit 98AA(+) and cavity 3 circuit 98CA(-) to ground.
At (384) measure resistance of circuits 98B(+)/98A(+) and 98AA(+) to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuits 98B(+)/ 98A(+) and 98AA(+) or dash conn. (3), then repair.
At (384) measure resistance of circuits 98D(-)/98C(-) and 98CA(-) to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuits 98D(-)/98C(-) and 98CA(-) or dash conn. (3), then repair.
Remove jumpers and reconnect (6011). Disconnect cluster connector (27) and install jumper wires from cavity 7 circuit 98E(+) and cavity 9 circuit 98F(-) to ground.
At (384) measure resistance of circuit 98B(+)/98E(+) to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 98B(+)/ 98E(+), then repair.
At (384) measure resistance of circuits 98D(-)/98F(-) to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 98D(-)/ 98F(-), then repair.
Reconnect (27). At ATA interface connector (374), measure resistance from circuit 98H(+) to (384) circuit 98B(+).
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 98B(+)/ 98H(+), then repair.
At ATA interface connector (374), measure resistance from circuit 98G(-) to (384) circuit 98D(-).
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 98D(-)/ 98G(-), then repair.
Data communication link circuitry checks good. If condition persists, refer to Engine Diagnostic Manual.
At power stud (1DVA), measure voltage from circuit 14J to ground.
Remove 20A fuse from connector (413) and check for open condition.
At (413) measure voltage from circuit 14D to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14D, then repair or replace cable assembly.
Re-install fuse. Disconnect engine harness connector (411) and measure voltage from circuit 14C to ground. Reconnect (411).
Locate open or poor con- nection in cir. 14J or dash conn. (2), then repair.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14C, then repair.
At power stud (2DVA), measure resistance from circuit 11-GC to ground.
Disconnect engine harness connector (409) and measure resistance of circuit 11-GB to ground. After corrections, go to next step.
Locate open or poor con- nection in cir. 11-GC or dash conn. (2), then repair.
Locate open in circuit 11-GB, then repair or replace cable assembly.
Reconnect connectors. Electronic device powering circuits check good.

svcsubproc.title: ECM Power and Ground System Circuitry

table.title: ECM Power and Ground System Circuitry

entry.para: Remove 50A power module maxifuse (408) and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse holder, measure voltage from circuit 14A to ground. Re-install fuse.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14A, then repair or replace cable assembly.
Check fuse F39 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At F39 fuse cavity A, measure voltage from circuit 97HB to ground.

Refer to 12 Volt Power Distribution (Battery)
in Section 1.
Check fuse F40 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At F40 fuse cavity A, measure voltage from circuit 97LD to ground.

Refer to 12 Volt Power Distribution (Battery)
in Section 1.
Check fuse F12 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At F12 fuse cavity A, measure voltage from circuit 13 to ground.

Refer to 12 Volt Power Distribution (Key Switch)
in Section 1.
Disconnect ECM2 connector (6020) and measure resistance of circuits at harness cavities 6 and 7 to ground.
Disconnect IDM2 connector (6011) and measure resistance of circuits at harness cavity 1 to ground.
Disconnect engine harness/ negative battery cable connector (409). At cable cavity A, measure resistance of circuit 11-GA to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GA, then repair or replace cable assembly.
Locate open or poor connection in circuits 11-G/97-GV, 11-G/97-GW, or 11-G/97-GA, then repair.
At (6020) harness cavity 3, measure voltage from circuit 97UA to ground.
At (6011) harness cavity 9, measure voltage from circuit 97UB to ground.
Disconnect dash connector (3). Turn key on and at cavity 15, measure voltage from circuit 97CR to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97CR, then repair.
At (6020), measure voltage from harness cavity 5 circuit 97J to ground.
Remove ECM power relay (590B). At socket cavity 8B, measure voltage from circuit 97JA to ground.
Disconnect dash connector (411). At cavity A, measure voltage from circuit 14B/97JA to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14B, then repair.
Measure resistance of circuit 97J between relay (590B), socket cavity 6C, and ECM2 connector (6020), cavity 5.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97JA, then repair.
At (6021) measure voltage from harness cavities 1, 2, and at (6011) cavity 10 to ground.
Remove ECM power relay (590B). At socket cavity 6B, measure voltage from circuit 14B/97HB, fuse F39, and 97HA to ground.
Disconnect positive battery/ engine harness connector (411) and at circuit 14B, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14B, then repair.
Measure resistance of circuits between relay (590B), socket cavity 8C, and ECM2 connector (6021), cavities 1, 2, and IDM2 connector (6011), cavity 10.
Locate open or poor connection in circuits 97TA/97CL, 97TA/97CK, or 97TA/97AL, then repair.
At (6011), measure voltage from harness cavity 8 circuit 97LA to ground.
Remove IDM power relay (590A). At socket cavity 8B, measure voltage from circuit 97LB to ground.
Disconnect dash connector (411). At cavity A, measure voltage from circuit 14B/97LB to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14B, then repair.
Measure resistance of circuit 97LA between relay (590A), socket cavity 6C, and IDM2 connector (6011), cavity 8.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97LB, then repair.
At (6011) measure voltage from harness cavities 6 and 12 to ground.
Remove IDM power relay (590A). At socket cavity 6B, measure voltage from circuit 14B/97TC to ground.
Disconnect positive battery/ engine harness connector (411) and at circuit 14B, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14B, then repair.
Measure resistance of circuits between relay (590A), socket cavity 8C, and IDM2 connector (6011), cavities 6 and 12.
Locate open or poor connection in circuits 97TA/97Y, 97TA/97LD, or 97TA, F40 and 97LC, then repair.
Reconnect connectors. Power module and ground system circuits check good. Should condition persist, refer to Engine Diagnostics Manual for ECM2 diagnostics.

svcsubproc.title: Accelerator (APS/IVS), Barometric Air Pressure (BAP), and Ambient Air Temperature Sensor (ATS) Systems

table.title: Accelerator (APS/IVS), Barometric Air Pressure (BAP), and Ambient Air Temperature Sensor (ATS) Systems

entry.para: Is a fault code present for APS/IVS sensor/switch?
Check circuit breaker F10 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace circuit breaker.
Disconnect APS/IVS conn. (382) and at cavity F, measure voltage from circuit 99E to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 99E, then repair.
At (382), install jumper from cavity A, circuit 99B to ground. Disconnect ECM2 connector (6021). At cavity 18, measure resistance from circuit 99B to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 99B or dash conn. (3), then repair.
At (382), move jumper to cavity B, circuit 99A and ground. At (6021) cavity 24, measure resistance of circuit 97W to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97W, dash conn. (3), or circuit 97W/99A, then repair.
At (382), move jumper to cavity C, circuit 99J and ground. At (6021) cavity 4, measure resistance of circuit 99C to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 99C, dash conn. (3), or circuit 99C/99J, then repair.
At (382), move jumper to cavity D, circuit 99D and ground. At (6021) cavity 12, measure resistance of circuit 99D to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 99D, or dash conn. (3), then repair.
Remove jumper and reconnect connectors. APS/IVS circuits check good. Is problem corrected?
Replace APS/IVS. If problem persists, refer to Engine Diagnostic Manual for ECM2 diagnostics.
Is a fault code present for BAP sensor?
Disconnect BAP sensor connector (437). Install jumper wire from cavity 1, circuit 97Z to ground. Disconnect ECM2 connector. (6021). At cavity 24, measure resistance of circuit 97W to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97W, dash conn. (3), or circuit 97W, then repair.
At (437), move jumper wire to cavity 2, circuit 97BL and ground. At (6021) cavity 4, measure resistance of circuit 99C to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 99C, dash conn. (3), or circuit 99C/97BL, then repair.
At (437), move jumper wire to cavity 3, circuit 97CD and ground. At (6020) cavity 24, measure resistance of circuit 97CD to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97CD or dash conn. (3), then repair.
Remove jumper and reconnect connectors. BAP system circuits check good. Is problem corrected?
Replace BAP sensor. If problem persists, refer to Engine Diagnostic Manual for ECM2 diagnostics.
Is a fault code present for the ATS system?
Disconnect ATS connector (463). Install jumper wire from cavity B, circuit 97AX to ground. Disconnect IDM2 connector (6011). At cavity 5, measure resistance from circuit 97AX to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97AX, then repair.
At (463), move jumper to cavity A, circuit 97BU and ground. At (6021) cavity 24, measure resistance of circuit 97W to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97W/ 97BU, then repair.
Remove jumper and reconnect connectors. ATS system circuits check good. Is problem corrected?
Replace ATS. If problem persists, refer to Engine Diagnostic Manual for ECM2 diagnostics.
Are both the engine (0x00) and the MSM (aka ESC) on the Datalink?
Does the input in MD change with the switch changes?
Does the input in MD change with the switch changes?
MSM is functioning properly. Check that cruise control is enabled in the engine controller
1. Verify Cruise ON/OFF switch and wiring, OFF state
Is pin 8 open to ignition when switch is OFF?
Repair wiring or switch, and retest
1. Verify Cruise ON/OFF switch and wiring, ON state
Is pin 8 shorted to ignition when switch is ON?
Repair wiring or switch, and retest
1. Verify Cruise SET/RES switch and wiring, normal state
Is pin 9 open to ground and ignition when switch is not pressed?
Repair wiring or switch, and retest
1. Verify Cruise SET/RES switch and wiring, RESUME state
Is pin 9 shorted to ground when switch is moved to RESUME?
Repair wiring or switch, and retest
1. Verify Cruise SET/RES switch and wiring, SET state
2. Turn Cruise ON/OFF switch to ON
Is pin 9 shorted to ignition when switch is moved to SET?
Repair wiring or switch, and retest
Is the engine (0x00) on the Datalink?
3. Measure resistance across datalink pins in wiring harness
2. Measure the voltage at the MSM's harness ignition pin
1. Measure the resistance between the MSM's harness ground pin and ground
Is the resistance less than 10 ohms?
Is the MSM (aka ESC) on the Datalink?
Check the engine's power connections and data link wiring.
Remove circuit breaker F21. and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse holder, measure voltage from circuit 90B to ground. Re-install fuse.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuits 90-FL/90/90B, dash conn. (2), or circuit 90B, then repair or replace cable assembly.
Disconnect MSM connector (3041). Turn key and cruise switch (391) on. At (3041), measure voltage from circuit 97CF cavity 8 to ground.
Disconnect cruise on/off switch (391) and with switch in on position, measure resistance across terminals.
At Brake/Cruise Interface Relay connector (1133), measure voltage from circuit 97B to ground. Reconnect connectors.
Repair open or poor con- nection in circuit 97B.
Check open circuit breaker F13. If okay, locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97B, then repair.
With on/off switch on and set/resume switch held in set position, measure voltage at MSM connector (3041) from circuit 97CA cavity 9 to ground.
Disconnect cruise set/resume switch (392). With switch held in set position, measure resistance across terminals 1 to 2.
With on/off switch on and at connector (392), measure voltage from circuit 97DH to ground. Reconnect connectors.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97CA, then repair.
With on/off switch on and set/resume switch held in resume position, measure voltage at MSM connector (3041) from circuit 97DK cavity 9 to ground.
Disconnect cruise set/resume switch (392). With switch held in resume position, measure resistance across terminals 2 to 3. Reconnect connectors.
Repair open in cir. 97-GE, 97-GJ 97DK, or poor con- nection to Cab ground.
Is the vehicle equipped with remote engine controls?
Disconnect body builder installed remote engine controls connector (N/L) at cowl power distribution center. At connector, measure voltage from circuit 97DF to ground.
Remote engine controls conn. (N/L), 97DF to gnd.
Check for open circuit breaker F11. If OK, locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97DF, dash conn. (3), or circuit 97DF, then repair.
Measure resistance of circuit 46B between (N/L) connector circuit 46B and ECM2 connector (6020), cavity 21.
Locate open in circuit 46B, then repair.
Measure resistance of circuit 46A between (N/L) connector circuit 46A and ECM2 connector (6020), cavity 14.
Locate open in circuit 46A, then repair.
Measure resistance of circuit 97CC between (N/L) connector and ECM2 connector (6020), cavity 20.
Locate open in circuit 97CC, then repair.
Measure resistance of circuit 97CB between (N/L) connector and ECM2 connector (6020), cavity 19.
Locate open in circuit 97CB, then repair.
Measure resistance of circuit 97AR between (N/L) connector and ECM2 connector (6020), cavity 11.
Locate open in circuit 97AR, then repair.
Measure resistance of circuit 47B between (N/L) connector and ECM2 connector (6020), cavity 17.
Locate open in circuit 47B, then repair.
Reconnect connectors. If condition persists, refer to Miscellaneous Information in CT-471 Body Builder Book.
Reconnect connectors. Cruise control circuitry checks good. If condition persists, refer to Engine Diagnostic Manuals for ECM2 diagnostics.
